attack.name: Attack
attack.description: When you make an attack, choose a target that you can see. If your weapon does not have a range, the target must be within 5ft of you. If it does have a range, the target can be within twice the range listed. If the target is greater than the range listed but less than twice the range listed, the attack roll is made at disadvantage. Then, roll the skill listed under attack skill. If the damage type is physical or does multiple types of damage, the target rolls agility, otherwise, the target rolls willpower. If you succeed, the attack hits. Roll the damage die listed for that weapon, add the modifier for the attack skill, and the target takes that much damage. If you roll a natural 20 on an attack roll, any damage you deal as a result of that attack is doubled, and you roll on the critical success table. If you roll a natural 1 on the attack roll, the attack automatically misses, and you roll a d24 on the critical fail table. If you attack a creature that cannot sense you, you gain advantage on the attack roll. You can also attack a location if you believe there to be a target there. The attack has disadvantage, and if there is nothing there to hit, it is an automatic miss.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: You gain an additional action on your next turn.

distract.name: Distract
distract.description: You attempt to draw an opponent's attention. Roll persuasion against the willpower of a creature within 20 feet. If you succeed, the next attack by someone other than you against the creature has advantage.

dodge.name: Dodge
dodge.description: You focus your efforts towards avoiding attacks. You gain +1 to all agility rolls to avoid attacks and features, until the start of your next turn.

draw.name: Draw Items
draw.description: You can stow up to two items from your hands or body into your inventory, and then draw up to two items from your inventory into your hands or onto your body. In addition, you can switch which items are in which hands.

frighten.name: Frighten
frighten.description: You attempt to scare off an enemy. Roll intimidation against the willpower of a creature within 20 feet. If you succeed, the creature becomes frightened of you until the start of your side's next turn.

help.name: Help
help.description: You attempt to assist an ally. When a creature on your side rolls a skill as part of an action, you can take an action at the same time to add your synergy modifier or your modifier of the skill they are rolling to their roll, whichever is lower.

interact.name: Interect with Object
interact.description: You pick up, kick away, pull, open, move, or interact in some other way with an object that no one is holding or wearing. A skill roll of the DM's choice may be required.

move.name: Move
move.description: You begin moving a distance up to your speed. You can take other actions at any point of this movement.

offHandAttack.name: Off-hand Attack
offHandAttack.description: You strike with a weapon in your off-hand. If you already made an attack with a light weapon this turn, you can use an action to make another attack with a light weapon in your off-hand. You can make an attack this way only once per turn.

ready.name: Ready
ready.description: You prepare to take an action outside of your turn. Choose an action and a trigger. If the chosen action is cardinal, so is this action. If the trigger occurs before the start of your side's next turn, you can use your reaction to perform that action.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: You reload one weapon that you are holding that has the loading property.

stepAway.name: Step Away
stepAway.description: You carefully step away from enemies. You move five feet, and enemies cannot take opportunity attacks against you during this movement.

takeCover.name: Take Cover
takeCover.description: If there is someone or something your size or larger, you can take cover behind it as an action. You have advantage on agility rolls to avoid anything that originates from the other side of the cover.

skill.name: Use a skill
skill.description: You attempt to take some other action that requires a skill roll. The DM decides the skill you use and the DC to meet.

wrestle.name: Wrestle
wrestle.description: If you have a free hand, roll athletics against the athletics of a creature within 5 feet that is your size or smaller. If you succeed, choose a wrestling maneuver to perform. If you roll a natural 20, you can choose two maneuvers. If you roll a natural 1, your target can apply a maneuver to you.

disarm.name: Disarm
disarm.description: The target drops one item of your choice in their space.

grab.name: Grab
grab.description: The target becomes grappled by you until they escape.

seize.name: Seize
seize.description: You forcibly lift the target up into the air. The target becomes grappled by you until they escape. While grappled this way, the target has advantage on attacks against you, ranged weapon attacks have advantage against the target.

shove.name: Shove
shove.description: You move the target up to 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

tackle.name: Tackle
tackle.description: You and the target become prone. The target becomes grappled by you until they escape or you stand up.

throw.name: Throw
throw.description: You can choose this maneuver only if you are already grappling the target. You throw them and they land prone up to 20 feet away from you.

trip.name: Trip
trip.description: The target becomes prone until they stand up.

opportunityAttack.name: Attack of Opportunity
opportunityAttack.trigger: A creature that you can see moves out of a space within 5 feet of you as part of the move action.
opportunityAttack.result: You can take the attack action, targeting the creature that triggered the attack.

ready.name: Ready
ready.trigger: An event occurs that you choose as a trigger when you took the Ready action.
ready.result: You perform the action you chose as part of the Ready action.

identify.name: Identify
identify.trigger: A creature you can see uses a feature or item, or the effect of a passive feature is applied.
identify.result: You can make a knowledge roll with a DC chosen by the DM. If you succeed, the DM describes the feature or item to you.
